tidbits.title: Autonomous Region
tidbits.description: The Åland Islands are an autonomous and demilitarized region of Finland, with Swedish as the primary language and a distinct cultural identity.

tidbits.title: Maritime Location
tidbits.description: Located in the Baltic Sea, the islands have a maritime heritage and are known for their picturesque landscapes, archipelagoes, and boating opportunities.

tidbits.title: Cultural Heritage
tidbits.description: The Åland Islands have a rich cultural heritage with traditions, festivals, and historical sites, including medieval churches and maritime museums.
